update.description:
Added the circle, cross and triangle symbols.

* The symbols are separate white models that can be reused in the future.
* All symbols are running a `gazebo_ros_color` plugin, so it’s possible to change its color via a ROS message.
* The placard is a new model with a white background and the three symbols. Note that the symbols are transparent, so none of them are visible by default.
* There's a `symbol_controller` plugin running in each placard to allow a fix configuration \(e.g. green circle\) or a random configuration. This plugin also accepts a service request to create a new random configuration.

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/2377027615-placard.gif)
*Note: This pull request is built atop of pull request #27, which should be merged first.*
update.title: Symbols and placards

content.raw: Done in [abdebf6](#!/osrf/vmrc/commits/abdebf61b1d3597988fa5ddd85d67fc4296f4ae8?at=default). There's room for improve the way `dock_2016/model.sdf` and `dock_2018/model.sdf` are created with some templating but I ran out of time.
content.html: Done in abdebf6. There's room for improve the way dock_2016/model.sdf and dock_2018/model.sdf are created with some templating but I ran out of time.

update.title: Symbols and placards

content.raw: Is this an issue? It’s in lines 11-13.
content.html: Is this an issue? It’s in lines 11-13.

content.raw: Suggestion: change the dock\_2016 model to dock\_2016\_base and make dock\_2016 contain the placards already \(same for 2018\). I think that would be cleaner as most users will assume the dock contains the placard already \(it was always there for the competition\)
content.html: Suggestion: change the dock_2016 model to dock_2016_base and make dock_2016 contain the placards already (same for 2018). I think that would be cleaner as most users will assume the dock contains the placard already (it was always there for the competition)

content.raw: found in #30 that you should omit the scope for the model this is \(just link instead of placard::link\), allowing it to be included as a submodel
content.html: found in #30 that you should omit the scope for the model this is (just link instead of placard::link), allowing it to be included as a submodel
